wikipedia_page.main: Sir Richard Runciman Terry (3 January 1864 – 18 April 1938) was an English organist, choir director and musicologist. He is noted for his pioneering revival of Tudor liturgical music.

response: He was a Christian socialist as an undergraduate at Worcester College, Oxford, where he was a classmate of Richard Runciman Terry. He became an organiser of the Independent Labour Party (ILP), and supported socialist causes. In 1896 he was an ILP member in Leeds.Liberty, vol. III, no. 4, April 1896, p. 8
* Richard Terry (musicologist), Sir Richard Runciman Terry, organist, choir director and musicologist
